extendedIngredients.name: cilantro
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 to 3 tablespoons chopped cilantro, for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: lemon juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice (about 2 lemons)

recipes.title: Restaurant-Style Hummus

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine are great choices for Hummus. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. The Bellissima Sparkling rosé with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: In a small bowl, add the lemon juice and water. Mix to combine. In another small bowl, add the tahini and olive oil. Whisk until smooth.Set aside a small handful of the chickpeas for garnish. Add the remaining chickpeas, garlic, salt, cumin and cayenne to the bowl of a food processor. Process until the mixture is finely ground, about 15 to 20 seconds. Scrape down the sides of the bowl.With the food processor running, slowly add in the lemon / water mixture through the feed tube. Process for one minute and then scrape down the sides of the bowl. Next, with the food processor running, slowly add in the tahini / olive oil mixture through the feed tube. Process for another minute, until the mixture is smooth and creamy.Transfer the hummus to an airtight container and place in the refrigerator for an hour to allow the flavors to meld. To serve, top with reserved chickpeas, chopped cilantro and drizzle with a little olive oil.

steps.step: In a small bowl, add the lemon juice and water.
Mix to combine. In another small bowl, add the tahini and olive oil.
Whisk until smooth.Set aside a small handful of the chickpeas for garnish.

Add the remaining chickpeas, garlic, salt, cumin and cayenne to the bowl of a food processor. Process until the mixture is finely ground, about 15 to 20 seconds. Scrape down the sides of the bowl.With the food processor running, slowly add in the lemon / water mixture through the feed tube. Process for one minute and then scrape down the sides of the bowl. Next, with the food processor running, slowly add in the tahini / olive oil mixture through the feed tube. Process for another minute, until the mixture is smooth and creamy.

Transfer the hummus to an airtight container and place in the refrigerator for an hour to allow the flavors to meld. To serve, top with reserved chickpeas, chopped cilantro and drizzle with a little olive oil.
